intro: Pedicularis artselaeri var. wutaiensis, commonly known as the Wutai Rhododendron, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that resemble those of rhododendrons. The plant is hemiparasitic, meaning it derives some of its nutrients from the roots of other plants while also performing photosynthesis. It typically grows in rocky or forested areas at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
